entry.title: Here are seven super foods you should be eating
entry.content:
Blueberries

Beneficial Compounds:

Anthocyanins, Polyphenols, Phtyochemicals

Almonds

Beneficial Compounds:

Dietary Fiber, Monounsaturated Fats, Polyunsaturated Fat, Riboflavin, Niacin

Avocado

Beneficial Compounds:

Dietary Fiber, Monounsaturated Fats, Polyunsaturated Fat, Riboflavin, Niacin

Chocolate

Beneficial Compounds:

Dietary Fiber, Theobromine, Vitamins B12, Riboflavin, Magnesium, Manganese

Green Tea

Beneficial Compounds:

Caffeine, Theanine, Theobromine, Theophylline

Kale

Beneficial Compounds:

Vitamin A, Vitamin C, Vitamin K, Vitamin B6, Folate, Manganese

Salmon

Beneficial Compounds:

Omega-3 Fatty Acids, Phosphorus, Vitamin D

entry.title: 5 tips everyone should try to save money
entry.content:
Brew your own coffee at home

Potential Money Saved:

A typical chain restaurant coffee can set you back up to $3 a day. That same coffee can be brewed at home for just 20 cents. This switch could save you hundreds of dollars a year.

Eat more rice, lentils and beans

Potential Money Saved:

Rice, lentils and beans are incredibly inexpensive and good for you. In addition, they pack a lot of fiber and in the case of beans and lentils, a lot of plant protein. Purchasing in bulk can reduce the price of each to under two dollars a pound.

Wait one month before making any non-essential purchases

Potential Money Saved:

Impulse purchases can lead to wasting money on a lot of unnecessary items. To curb money spent on random gadgets, implement a 30 day waiting period for any purchases you make that arenâ€™t essential to living.

Get books, dvds and magazines at your library

Potential Money Saved:

Your local library is filled with plenty of things for your entertainment all at no cost. So rather than spending $10 to $20 bucks on a dvd, see if its at your library first.

Cut your cable and your home phone

Potential Money Saved:

Your tv and home phone subscription can be more than a hundred dollars a month. Much of the same features can be achieved with a cell phone and access to the internet.

entry.title: 7 Habits of successful people
entry.content:
Maintain a to-do list

Why?:

By writing down a list of things that need to be done for the next day, you increase your likelihood of achieving those goals and decrease the amount of time you waste not doing anything.

Listen to audio books

Why?:

63% of successful individuals listen to audio books during their commute instead of music.

Watch less tv

Why?:

Successful people watch very little television, one study shows that 67% of wealthy individuals watch less than an hour of tv a day. Compare that to the 78% of poor individuals that watch more than an hour of reality tv a day.

Read for self improvement

Why?:

88% percent of successful individuals read everyday to improve themselves and learn something new.

Wake up early

Why?:

Most of the top earning CEOs in the country are early risers, typically up before 6 a.m., this is the time of the day where distractions are at a minimum.

Automate tasks

Why?:

Donâ€™t do mundane tasks when you can find a computer program to do it for you, analyse what day to day tasks you do that are repetitive. Chances are there is a piece of software that can help you do it better.

Spend wisely

Invest

Why?:

Successful people pour a larger than average percentage of their earning into pensions, retirement plans and insurance.
